message: Hey people. As an opensource fanatic, when I used linux I loved mutt client. I know it can be used on osx but do you guys know any email client with the same idea?
Mutt was simple and keyboard centered
I see sparrowmail is going there and I'm happy, but i would like it to be more flexible
Sparrow seems interesting, not Encryption support yet :( http://getsatisfaction.com/sparrow
Sparrow is awesome, but definitely anti-mutt
It sends HTML email, doesn't allow for hard-wrapping or monospaced fonts for core
It also does not do well with quoting replies
If you're an emacs user, gnus is similar afaik.

I'd like that Sparrow had more visual shot defining labels. I mean, that small triangle doesnt do the trick. I really use labels a lot and in gmail I know with one look which mails to read or not according the label. Here is just all the same
@justinlilly VI FTW
@aseba you aren't using mutt because... ? You want to be more "mac user" ish?
good luck. :)
@aseba I know a few people who use emacs just for the mail client. *shrug*

@justinlilly I do too... I kind of hate emacs.. But I've used mutt a long time and I really miss it. Probably I'll go back in not to long.... I love to use the terminal, and for some reason Mac developers likes to use the mouse a lot....

@justinlilly no, beacuse I kind of hate compiling software for the mac and because at work I dont have the pop3 or IMAP port opened :/.. But HEY I just sent my resignation letter.. I'm out on april :P
(not joking I sent it)
ime, that involves giving up on certain power features in exchange for something that works a bit better.
ssh into a VPS that runs mutt.
hehe, thanks.. I'm giving sparrow a try...
@justinlilly I thought that, but here in Argentina internet is crappy and I cant risk to not being able to read emails
Take a look at Sup http://sup.rubyforge.org/
That sup looks amazing but I can't get it to compile… :| Tried installing ncurses and ncursesw but still no luck :(
Mutt is the awesome. For SMTP I use the light msmtp. Works great for Google mail. Oh, Mutt inside a Terminator buffer in Linux, and must try inside an iTerm2 buffer in OSX
http://danielchoi.com/software/vmail.html
